alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Washakie (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 23 at 2:28PM MDT until June 23 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Riverton has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Johnson County in north central Wyoming... Eastern Washakie County in central Wyoming... * Until 300 PM MDT. * At 228 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 14 miles west of Hole In The Wall, which is also 23 miles west of Kaycee, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Johnson and eastern Washakie Counties, including the following locations... Barnum. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for north central Wyoming. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
